messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

raw_message.content:

I’m free 09:00–11:30 and 14:30–17:00.\n- Wed (12th): Mostly free except 13:00–14:00.\n- Thu (13th): Back-to-back customer calls 09:00–15:00.\n- Fri (14th): Free after 11:00.\n\nIf this is about the redesign alignment Taylor mentioned, I’d lean towards Tue afternoon or Wed morning.\n\nCheers,\nJordan\n",

            "body": "Hi Alex,\n\nSupport rota is a bit awkward next week:\n\n- Mon (10th): On triage 09:00–13:00, freer in the afternoon.\n- Tue (11th): Better after 14:00 (morning is ticket backlog + training).\n- Wed (12th): I’m on incident escalation 11:00–15:00.\n- Thu (13th): Generally ok, but I’d prefer not before 10:00.\n- Fri (14th): Trying to keep it light; could do 09:00–10:00 or 14:00–16:00.\n\nIf this is the planning chat for the Website Redesign you and Taylor mentioned, Tue after 14:00 works well for me.\n\nThanks,\nSam\n",

No single artifact alone fully states all required details."

    {

            "subject": "Timeline for new website navigation and account area revamp",

We’re planning our own Q1 campaigns around this and need to know roughly when those changes will hit production.\n\nCan you share an approximate ETA for when the new nav and account experience will be live for us?\n\nThanks,\nAlex\nCustomer Success Manager, ClientCo\n",
            "status": "open",

              "customer-eta",

          "description": "Sam adds an internal note on the ticket, mentioning they believe the request maps to a core Website Redesign feature tracked in Jira but without specifying the issue key.",
          "details": {
            "ticket_id": "SUP-4832",

            "type": "internal_note",
            "body": "Pretty sure this is about the core navigation + account area work in the Website Redesign. Need to double-check which WEB ticket owns the front-door nav rollout before giving an ETA. Will sync with Alex/Taylor or check Jira.",
            "visibility": "internal"
          }
        },
        {

          "source": "slack",

          "channel": "support-eng-handoff",
          "description": "Sam posts in the support-eng-handoff Slack channel asking which Jira issue covers the customer-facing navigation changes related to the Website Redesign, referencing the support ticket number but not the Jira key.",
          "details": {
            "message_id": "slack_sup_eng_20251105_091530",
            "text": "Heads up on SUP-4832: ClientCo is asking when they’ll see the new site nav + account area. I know this is part of the Website Redesign, but can someone confirm which Jira item actually tracks the nav rollout so I don’t give a bogus ETA?",
            "mentions": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "thread_root": null
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "feature_rollout_eta_slack_reply_alex",
          "source": "slack",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-05T09:22:10+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "channel": "support-eng-handoff",
          "description": "Alex replies in the thread clarifying that the customer’s question corresponds to a specific Jira epic and references WEB-101 as the ticket that owns the core feature, but does not provide an explicit ETA.",
          "details": {
            "message_id": "slack_sup_eng_20251105_092210",
            "text": "Good catch. The customer-visible nav + account area experience is under the Website Redesign epic and the main implementation is tracked in WEB-101 (\"Website Redesign - Core Feature\"). There are a couple of follow-on tasks, but WEB-101 is the one that matters for when they’ll actually see the new experience.",
            "mentions": [
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "thread_root": "slack_sup_eng_20251105_091530"
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "feature_rollout_eta_jira_status_update",
          "source": "jira",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-05T10:05:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_taylor_brown",
          "description": "Taylor updates Jira issue WEB-101 status and adds a comment describing the expected timeline relative to the project launch date.",
          "details": {
            "issue_key": "WEB-101",
            "change_type": "status_and_comment",
            "previous_status": "In Progress",
            "new_status": "In Progress",
            "comment_id": "WEB-101-comment-20251105-1",
            "comment_body": "Status for customer comms (e.g., SUP-4832 / ClientCo):\n\n- Backend + feature flag scaffolding: done and merged.\n- New navigation + account shell UI: dev-complete by 2025-11-18.\n- Staged rollout behind flag: starting 2025-11-22, ramping over ~1 week.\n\nAssuming no major regressions, customers like ClientCo should see the new experience by end of November (aligned with WEB launch target 2025-11-30).",
            "updated_fields": {
              "labels": [
                "customer-visible",
                "eta-communicated"
              ]
            }
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "feature_rollout_eta_slack_followup_sam",
          "source": "slack",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-05T10:18:40+00:00",
          "actor": "person_sam_williams",
          "channel": "support-eng-handoff",
          "description": "Sam posts a follow-up message summarizing the ETA for internal alignment, based on reading Taylor’s Jira comment on WEB-101.",
          "details": {
            "message_id": "slack_sup_eng_20251105_101840",
            "text": "Thanks! I checked WEB-101 and Taylor’s latest comment. For SUP-4832 / ClientCo: core nav + account changes should be dev-complete by 18 Nov, with rollout starting around 22 Nov and targeting full availability by end of November (aligned with the Website Redesign launch). I’ll phrase this as: \"late November\" in the customer reply unless anyone objects.",
            "mentions": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_taylor_brown"
            ],
            "thread_root": "slack_sup_eng_20251105_091530"
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "feature_rollout_eta_ticket_public_reply",
          "source": "support_tool",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-05T10:32:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_sam_williams",
          "description": "Sam adds a public reply to the customer ticket SUP-4832 with an approximate ETA derived from the Jira WEB-101 comment, without mentioning Jira or the issue key to the customer.",
          "details": {
            "ticket_id": "SUP-4832",
            "comment_id": "SUP-4832-comment-2",
            "type": "public_reply",
            "body": "Hi Alex,\n\nThanks for your patience while we checked with the product and engineering teams.\n\nThe new navigation and revamped account area are in active development right now. The current plan is:\n\n- Development to wrap up in the second half of November.\n- A staged rollout shortly after that.\n\nBarring any unexpected issues, you should see the new experience live on your side towards the end of November.\n\nWe’ll keep you posted if anything changes.\n\nBest,\nSam\nSupport\n",
            "visibility": "public",
            "status_after": "pending"
          }
        }
      ],
      "inference_notes": "To answer a question about the ETA of the feature, one must (1) identify that the customer’s request in support ticket SUP-4832 refers to the Website Redesign navigation/account experience, (2) see Sam’s internal note and Slack message tying the request to the Website Redesign, (3) read Alex’s Slack reply that maps the request to Jira issue WEB-101, and (4) inspect WEB-101’s latest comment by Taylor that describes the rollout timeline relative to late November. The customer-facing ETA is then summarized in Sam’s public reply, which does not mention Jira explicitly."
    },
    {
      "id": "weekly_report",
      "type": "weekly_report",
      "abstract_description": "PM summarizes weekly wins such as performance improvements and user growth.",

        "performance_improvement_percent": 15,
        "users_growth_percent": 10
      },
      "events": [
        {

          "source": "slack",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T08:32:10+00:00",

          "description": "Alex asks the data team in Slack to confirm performance and user growth numbers for the weekly report, without specifying exact target percentages.",
          "details": {
            "message_id": "slack_data_20251107_083210",
            "text": "Morning all — for the Website Redesign update in my weekly report, can someone sanity-check the latest numbers for:\n\n- Relative improvement in p95 load time for the main entry pages\n- Week-over-week change in weekly active users touching any of the new WEB surfaces\n\nI pulled a quick export but want to make sure I’m not misreading it.",
            "mentions": [],
            "thread_root": null
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "weekly_report_slack_data_reply",
          "source": "slack",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T08:45:40+00:00",
          "actor": "system",
          "channel": "data-insights",
          "description": "A data team bot replies in Slack summarizing the metrics from the analytics export, confirming roughly 15% performance improvement and 10% user growth.",
          "details": {
            "message_id": "slack_data_20251107_084540",
            "text": "Automated summary for WEB (2025-10-31 to 2025-11-06):\n\n- p95 load time for redesign entry pages improved from 3200 ms to 2720 ms (~15% faster).\n- Weekly active users on WEB-tagged pages increased from 10,000 to 11,000 (~10% growth).\n\nLet me know if you need a chart-ready version.",
            "mentions": [
              "person_alex_smith"
            ],
            "thread_root": "slack_data_20251107_083210"
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "weekly_report_draft_doc",
          "source": "docs",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T09:15:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "description": "Alex creates a Google Doc for the weekly report and drafts bullet points referencing the performance and user growth improvements.",
          "details": {
            "doc_id": "gdoc_weekly_report_WEB_2025_11_07",
            "title": "WEB – Weekly Report – 7 Nov 2025",
            "created_at": "2025-11-07T09:15:00+00:00",
            "last_edited_at": "2025-11-07T10:05:00+00:00",
            "content_excerpt": "Key Wins (Week of 31 Oct – 6 Nov)\n\n1) Performance\n- p95 load time on key WEB entry pages improved by ~15% after recent optimizations.\n- Early feedback from Support indicates fewer complaints around \"site feels slow\".\n\n2) Usage & Growth\n- Weekly active users on WEB-tagged pages up ~10% week-over-week, driven by increased discovery of the new flows.\n\n3) Project Health\n- On track for planning milestone (10 Nov) and dev milestone (20 Nov).",
            "collaborators": [
              "alex.smith@company.com",
              "taylor.brown@company.com"
            ]
          }
        },
        {
          "event_id": "weekly_report_email_send",
          "source": "email",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-07T10:15:00+00:00",
          "actor": "person_alex_smith",
          "description": "Alex sends out the weekly report email to the broader stakeholder list, summarizing the key wins including performance improvements and user growth.",
          "details": {
            "email_id": "email_20251107_101500_alex_weekly_report",
            "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
            "to": [
              "eng-all@company.com",
              "sales-leads@company.com",
              "support-leads@company.com"
            ],
            "cc": [
              "taylor.brown@company.com"
            ],
            "subject": "[WEB] Weekly Update – Performance & Usage Wins (7 Nov 2025)",
            "body": "Hi all,\n\nSharing this week’s highlights for the Website Redesign (WEB):\n\n1) Performance\n- We’re seeing roughly a 15% improvement in p95 load time on key entry pages after the latest round of optimizations.\n- Early signals from Support suggest fewer complaints about the site feeling slow.\n\n2) Usage & Growth\n- Weekly active users engaging with WEB-tagged surfaces grew by about 10% week-over-week.\n- We’ll keep monitoring whether this trend holds as more functionality rolls out.\n\n3) Project Health\n- We remain on track for the Planning milestone (10 Nov) and Development milestone (20 Nov), with the overall launch target still set for 30 Nov.\n\nThanks everyone for the continued push.\n\nAlex\nPM, Website Redesign\n",
            "attachments": [
              {
                "type": "link",
                "label": "Full weekly report doc",
                "url": "https://docs.google.com/document/d/gdoc_weekly_report_WEB_2025_11_07"
              }
            ]
          }
        }
      ],
      "inference_notes": "The weekly report content is not fully contained in one artifact. To reconstruct it, one must (1) see the analytics export with raw metrics, (2) read the data team bot’s Slack summary confirming roughly 15% performance improvement and 10% user growth, (3) inspect Alex’s draft Google Doc to see how these numbers are framed as \"key wins\", and (4) read the final email where Alex summarizes the wins and ties them to project milestones."
    }
  ],
